data.title: Spicy on demand
data.text:
The main request from us here was the food to be spicy, and yes-it was. We ordered Chicken Satay which wasnt that spicy but the Thai Curry Fried Rice or the Spicy Basil fried rice were truly spicy with a request of 5 star spicy. And our soup too was very spicy.
Really loved the food and our ever smiling and warm hostess ensured food was on time and spicy of course. 
Going back soon to try out more.

data.title: Good food good service, great prices!
data.text: We went in for lunch and were greeted and seated promptly. Complimentary salads were served within minutes! I had the stir fried prawns with broccoli at spice level 3. My wife had a chick in dish. The orders were served quickly by our friendly server but mine was wrong, chicken instead of prawns. She caught the error before placing on table and had it corrected quickly. Food was served hot in minimal time. I it was flavorful with just the right amount of heat/spice. The portions were generous and the prices very reasonable with friendly efficient service! Note it can be difficult finding on street parking though there is a pay lot next door.

data.title: Bad Service on Grubhub!
data.text: We placed an order on Grubhub for a Saturday night dinner.  45 minutes later they called to say their driver was sick and they could not deliver.  They told me I could pick up my order.  Grubhub is for delivery.  It was too late to order from another place in Everett.  Bad service!  I had to call Grubhub customer service to get my refund.  I will be ordering elsewhere.

data.title: Yuck!
data.text: We walked into this place and it looked like a cheap dirty cafe.  And what had us turn around an walk out after only a few minutes was the awful stench of dirt and mold.  The floor had filthy carpet on it and the seating was a bunch of tables and chairs in the middle of a big ugly room.  Just yuck!

data.title: You pay more than the menu says
data.text:
We arrived at noon on Sunday, just as they opened.  Only one other table was in use.  They gave us the lunch menu, we quickly made our decisions and put our menus down, then after we waited a while they came to take our orders.  The food came a reasonable time later.  It was tasty enough.

The problem came at the end when they brought us the bill.  Everything was a few dollars more than listed on the lunch menu they had given us.  

When I brought that to their attention, after a wait they told us that they don't use the lunch menu on Sunday.  I replied that the lunch menu is what the server gave us, and she didn't tell us that the lunch prices were not in effect.  

That didn't matter to the manager, and she wasn't at all apologetic even when I told her I was unhappy about this.  She refused to change the bill to show the price on the menu we were given.  I was forced to pay what was on the bill.

As we left, I commented to the manager that I didn't like paying more than the menu showed and would never return, but she didn't care.

Summary:  The food is good enough, the service is okay, but don't be surprised if you are charged more than what the menu says.  Apparently they would rather have those few extra dollars than have repeat customers.  They are right and the customer is wrong.

data.title: Will not be Back
data.text: Slow service, almost seem irritated you're there. Interior is dirty and shabby, food is hit and miss.

data.title: peanut sauce you want to get naked in!!!!
data.text: all I can say is try the chicken and spinach with peanut sauce...NO WORDS for how delish this was!!!

data.title: Not a bad spot for lunch.
data.text: This restaurant is located in downtown Everett. It has pretty good food with good sized portions. I had lunch there which was filling and included pad thai. Good service.

data.title: Curry dish was good
data.text: My husband and I had dinner here last night. We shared the 3 curry sampler ($15.95) with an extra rice ($1). Plenty of food for us and the curries were delicious! There was nothing absolutely fabulous about the restaurant or service. The restaurant is right across from the Comcast arena.

data.title: Usually good but service was bad this time
data.text: Usually a good choice but last night, the service was slow and not as friendly as usual.  Even had to wait to pay the check!  Will go again but since customer service is such an essential of a good restaurant, I was disappointed

data.title: Good quality Thai food
data.text: I stayed over in Everett for a few days with my family and wanted to eat something beside fast food. We found this place not too far from where we were staying. It was sadly a little empty for a Saturday late afternoon/early evening. I could see this place has a lot of potential to become a great late night club/Thai food restaurant hot spot, because it was nicely decorated and there was big open area with no tables or chairs. Still the food was good. We tried a salmon curry and phad thai. It was served pretty quick and tasted fresh without being too spicy.

data.title: Great food
data.text: I really like this Thai restaurant. The food is always good and the service is excellent. I really like the red coconut curry!

data.title: Pad Thai = rice noodles & ketsup
data.text: Beautiful decor but bad Pad Thai.  Other than that not much to say.   Blah, blah, blah

data.title: Nice Thai restaurant near Event Center
data.text: This is a very nice restaurant with a good menu selection and reasonable prices.  Several of the times I've been there a piano player has been giving a nice background performance.

data.title: One of my favorites
data.text: I work in the downtown area and this is one of my favorite lunch spots.  great food, good place for conversation

data.title: Expensive and Disappointing
data.text: This is the second time I have been to this restaurant; so, the atmosphere is okay, but the duct tape repairs on the carpet where you walk were definitely off-putting.  Still, I can put up with divey surroundings if the food is good;  the shrimp was not deveined and had that muddy flavor we all know,  the food here was decidedly very average and uninspiring, and paying 100 dollars for 4 people seemed like it was about twice what it should have been.

data.title: Very Good Thai Food
data.text: The food and service are exceptional.  This is a great Thai restaurant with many menu options.

data.title: Great Food
data.text: I would highly recommend this place. Great food. All the usual's. Great service

data.title: Delicious
data.text: Thai Gusto saved the day. I was so tired and hungry after arriving and checking-in. It was 8pm and I needed to find something for me and my vegetarian husband. Guso saved the day. I am a lot persnickety an this place fit the bill. I drove around and could not find anything that was appealing to the eyes from the outside and the internet search was not giving me good enough reviews for any of the restaurants. But I spotted Gusto just as I was about to give up and it was attractive enough outside and inside was clean, clean in the dining area. It worked in a pinch. The typical Pad Thai was heaven to a hungry and weak patron. Did not stay but took our food back to the hotel. Very grateful to Gusto for the quick service (15 mins) and good food in such a small town.

data.title: Affordable charm
data.text: Thai Gusto is a big space, brightly and imaginatively decorated with bold colors and patterns, across the street from the sports arena/convention center in Everett.  The place was almost empty when we were there.  The servers were charming and attentive.  We had a seafood medley and a shrimp with cashew dish that were delicious.  I had the black rice pudding (made with coconut milk) for dessert, which was one of the best desserts I've ever had.  The menu is extensive.  A big, multicourse lunch for two was about $50, including tip.  You could eat here for months and never repeat.  The chef came out after our meal to bask in our praise.   This restaurant felt genuinely Thai, not Chinese playing Thai.  However I could not find the portrait of the King that seems obligatory in Thai establishments.  They gave us a frequent diner card that gives a free entree after ten visits and entree purchases.
